The first night, we sat lake side with a glass of wine and a small fire, Ed left us enough fire wood to last an hour....it was very relaxing for the next day's busy schedule. The area had an unexpected heat wave the weekend we were there and although the cottage doesn't have a/c, we brought a fan (there's one in the cottage too) and survived, but didn't sleep good (we might be spoiled, as we have central a/c at home). I don't know the area well, and maybe we just caught the schedule just right, but there were freight trains at all hours through the night, that went through the area that can be heard, so if you're a light sleeper please keep this in mind. Otherwise, the cottage has everything you need, Ed is very easy to contact, check-in & check-out is super easy and sitting on the deck in the morning while we had our morning coffee was perfect. Per our future needs, we would consider Ed's cottage again.
